translated: The Mansion
The Mansion Chapter🔽The Divine Maiden’s Mansion
The Cittalatā Grove
The Divine Maiden’s Mansion of a Female Slave
“Is it Sakka, the lord of the gods,

analyzed: ramme citta latā vane  samantā anupariyāsi  nārī gaṇa purakkhatā
translated: in the beautiful Cittalatā Grove,🔽who is going around everywhere,🔽surrounded by a group of women,
illuminating all directions,

original: osadhī viya tārakā.🔽Kena tetādiso vaṇṇo,🔽kena te idha mijjhati;
analyzed: osadhī viya tārakā  kena tetādisaḥ vaṇṇaḥ  kena te idha mijjhati
translated: like the star of the medicine tree?🔽What is the cause of your beauty?🔽What is the cause of your radiance here?
And how do you obtain
all the wealth that is pleasing to the mind?
I ask you, O divine maiden of great power,
what merit did you make as a human being?
By what are you so radiant,

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and your beauty shines in all directions?”
That deity, being pleased,

analyzed: moggallānena pucchitā  pañham puṭṭhā viyākā asi
translated: when asked by Moggallāna,🔽answered the question
of the result of that deed:
“When I was a human being,

analyzed: dāsī ahosim parapessiyā kule  upāsikā cakkhumataḥ
translated: I was a slave in the family of another woman.🔽I was a lay disciple of the Buddha,
the renowned Gotama, the one with vision.
I was a follower
of that one of such virtue.
Let this body be destroyed,
there is no attachment here.
The five training rules,
The path is auspicious and peaceful.
It is not prickly or overgrown,
It is straight, known to all;
See the fruit of the one who has gone forth,
As it has been attained.
I am the one who is summoned
By Sakka, the lord of the Vasus;
Sixty thousand musical instruments
Make a sound to awaken me.
The frightening Alambusa,
The good speaker Saṃsaya,
Pokkharasa, Suphassa,
And the women Viṇāmokkhā.
Nandā and Sunandā,
Soṇadinnā and Sucimukhā,
Alambusā, Missakesī,
Puṇḍarīkā and Dāruṇī.
Eṇīphassā, Suphassā,
Subhaddā, and Muduvādinī;
These and other excellent women
Are the awakeners of the sugar-makers.
Having come to me in time,
The deities address me:
“Come, let us dance and sing,
Come, let us delight in that.
This is not for those who have not made merit,
But only for those who have made merit;
The sorrowless, delightful, beautiful
Great forest of the Thirty-Three.
Happiness for those who have not made merit,
Here there is none, but there is in the world beyond,
Happiness for those who have made merit,
both here and in the world beyond.
For those who desire to be with them,
much merit should be made;
For those who have made merit rejoice,
in heaven, possessing wealth.”🔽The Story of the Female Spirit is finished.
